briefdescription.para: Parse a sysfs cache size file that looks like "32K\n" or "12M\n".

simplesect.para: size in bytes (>=0), or 0 if unavailable.

briefdescription.para: Best-effort cache discovery on Linux sysfs.

detaileddescription.para: Fills l1, l2, l3 with detected values or leaves zeros if not found.

briefdescription.para: Initialize policy with detected cache sizes and sane defaults.

detaileddescription.para: The function attempts to read cache sizes from Linux sysfs and then applies internal heuristics to set prefetch_distance and nt_threshold_bytes. Environment variables listed in the file header override the computed values.

simplesect.para: 0 on success; negative value on error (e.g., invalid pointer).

briefdescription.para: Decide if non-temporal stores should be used for a given transfer size.

detaileddescription.para: The decision observes force_nt_on and force_nt_off first; otherwise it compares bytes with nt_threshold_bytes.

simplesect.para: true if non-temporal stores are recommended.

briefdescription.para: Recommend a prefetch distance in bytes for the given stride.

detaileddescription.para: The recommendation considers the policy prefetch distance, stride size, and attempts to keep the lead within a few cache lines.

simplesect.para: Distance in bytes to pass to the prefetch helpers.

briefdescription.para: Issue a T0 (cache-hot) prefetch distance bytes ahead of base.

parameterdescription.para: Lead distance in bytes (can be zero).

briefdescription.para: Issue a non-temporal (NTA) prefetch distance bytes ahead of base.

parameterdescription.para: Lead distance in bytes (can be zero).

memberdef.argsstring: (const void *base, size_t bytes, size_t stride, size_t distance)
memberdef.name: ie_stream_prefetch_range_t0

briefdescription.para: Prefetch a range using T0 hint at a given stride and lead distance.

parameterdescription.para: Step in bytes between prefetches (>= IE_CACHELINE_BYTES recommended).

memberdef.argsstring: (const void *base, size_t bytes, size_t stride, size_t distance)
memberdef.name: ie_stream_prefetch_range_nta

briefdescription.para: Prefetch a range using NTA hint at a given stride and lead distance.

memberdef.argsstring: (float *dst, const float *src, size_t n, const struct ie_stream_policy *p, double nt_ratio)
memberdef.name: ie_stream_copy_f32

briefdescription.para: Copy n floats from src to dst using optional non-temporal stores.

detaileddescription.para: If ie_stream_should_use_nt decides for streaming, the function uses wide non-temporal stores when available (AVX2/AVX-512). The nt_ratio allows mixing regular and streaming stores (e.g., 0.5 means half of the bulk uses streaming). For small tails or when features are unavailable, a scalar fallback is used.

parameterdescription.para: Number of float elements to copy.

memberdef.argsstring: (float *dst, float value, size_t n, const struct ie_stream_policy *p, double nt_ratio)
memberdef.name: ie_stream_memset_f32

briefdescription.para: Set n floats at dst to value using optional non-temporal stores.

parameterdescription.para: Number of float elements to set.
Fraction in [0,1] controlling the mix of streaming stores.

briefdescription.para: Heuristics and implementations for prefetch and non-temporal (streaming) stores.

detaileddescription.para:
Implementation highlights:
Cache size detection on Linux via sysfs: "/sys/devices/system/cpu/cpu0/cache/index<N>/size" with units "K" or "M".
Environment overrides (see ie_stream.h header doc).
Careful handling of alignment before issuing wide streaming stores.
